english_translation: Narrated from al-Zuhri, from Abu Idris al-Khawlani, from Ubadah ibn al-Samit who said: The Messenger of Allah ﷺ gave a pledge of allegiance to a group in which I was present. He recited to us the verse from Surah al-Nisa': 'and do not associate partners with Him' (verse 36). Then he said: Whoever fulfills it, his reward is upon Allah. Whoever commits a sin from that and is punished for it in this world, then it is a purification for him, or he said: an expiation. Whoever commits a sin from that and Allah conceals it for him, then his matter is with Allah. If He wills, He will forgive him, and if He wills, He will punish him.

english_translation: Narrated from al-Zuhri, from Urwah, from Aisha who said: Fatimah daughter of Uqbah ibn Rabi'ah came to pledge allegiance to the Prophet ﷺ. He took from her the covenant that she would not associate partners with Allah (the verse is mentioned). She placed her hand on her head out of shyness, which pleased the Messenger of Allah ﷺ regarding what he saw from her. Aisha said: Affirm, O woman! By Allah, we did not give allegiance except for this. She said: Yes, then so. He gave her the pledge of allegiance (the verse is mentioned).
